caption: Beautiful new location, we were at a private room and the service and food was amazing!

Alma is consistently amazing! There is no bad meal to be had here. The food is exotic and exquisite. The ethos of the owners and excellent staff is one of caring and enlightenment. Please do not hesitate to experience this brilliant restaurant. Arguably the most innovative food in Baltimore.

OMG What a treat. It was our first time out in a year. Their COVID protocol were spectacular. I felt safe the entire night. There's plenty of space the airflow was great there were plants nearby. Now let's move on to the food because this was the best meal I've had in a year. The fried Branzino was amazing I didn't realize bronzino could taste even better than it has. We also tried the yuca appetizer it was so tasty. The snapper ceviche melted in my mouth. What a great night

I don’t normally leave reviews but I valued this place as a special place before they moved. I was excited to go back but for my first experience back — I’ll have to to say their front of the house service has changed. They were rude when we were late to our reservation due to unforeseen circumstances in which we notified them about ahead of time. Proceeded to our table, i asked if they had an item on the menu (that was previously on their old menu), server responded “if it’s not on the menu, then we don’t have it”. Sorry this is just not a great customer service response. They proceeded to rush us through our dinner. For a place like alma i truly expected better comparing it to their old location. I hope everyone has a better experience with front staff because the food and drinks are great.
Amazing food and dining experience!

Alma is my favorite place for cocktails. Every time I think they've invented the best one ever, they come up with something new, fresh, sophisticated, and delicious. Alma also elevates the kale salad to a tender, tasty new level that is worthy of being an appetizer on a Saturday night. I go to Alma for my menu favorites, but often get pleasantly surprised. This time is was the blueberry and the coconut sorbet--a cool, delicious, and smooth dessert to end a summer meal on the patio.

Food, live guitarist Thursdays, ambiance...so great! (This was from 2019.)  2020- year of Covid galore- we went to Alma again and seriously, the food is delicious! (Eventhough the menu is limited due to the pandemic, the quality is still top notch!) I now have a new summer favorite...the gazpacho. Amazing. Really. And one day, when The Nacional (beef arepa) is not sold out, I'd like to try it, just in case I have additional favorite added to my list of favorites!

This has become one of my favorite places to dine in Baltimore. I never get authentic Venezuelan food my way. Stopped by recently with a friend for restaurant week and sampled some of their other menu items. We had the kale salad, la caraquena arepa, seafood paella, duck magret, and coconut ice cream. Alma pay close attention to detail. The arepas are a must order. The breading, seasoning and combination of flavors were amazing. The paella had so much seafood and the textures from the bomba rice to the perfectly cooked seared scallops were delicious. The duck is a must order! The couscous, rich duck and berry sauce were amazing. The cocktails here were also delicious. Definitely recommend getting a carafe for the best value. I booked way in advance to get a table here. With current Covid conditions Alma takes it very seriously. Currently, only doing outdoor dining and they have the staff cleaning tirelessly. My friend and I were really satisfied with our food and service. I'll definitely be back to try the other arepas and seasonal menu items
Wonderful date night outside on the patio! Beautiful vibes + beautiful lady = Bliss
Amazing! Great food, great ambiance and service. I'll be back for sure

I have been a regular at Alma Cocina Latina for a couple years now and suffice to say it’s my favorite restaurant in the whole city of Baltimore. Alma is tucked away in plain sight at the canning company in Canton, but once you walk inside you’ll be transported away from the city into a darling little oasis.  The foliage and tropical plants kindly invite diners in to a warm and recharging atmosphere. It’s not uncommon to be greeted table-side by the owners Irena and Mark who are genuine and authentic folks deeply grateful to have guests at their table, so to speak. The environment and soulful intention translates into the staff and management team who are always kind and friendly. Create the right environment and you will attract only the best. Alma has done just that.  The best part really about Alma is that the food and drinks are hands down unlike any other you will experience in Baltimore. Every dish is a unique masterpiece creatively designed and superbly executed. I am most definitely a foodie and having also lived internationally I have a broad and eclectic palate. I find myself trying new dishes in shock thinking, “Where has this been my whole life? Why is it that at 35 years old I am only trying “insert blank” for the first time?” It’s really a very eye opening and refreshing experience every time.  You cannot go wrong by choosing Alma over the larger restaurant groups in Baltimore. Alma’s essence is something special nowhere else has even touched. Thank you Alma Cocina Latina for being the Latin soul kitchen my heart and this city needs.  Favorite starters: the rabbit paradise, octopus & cracker, caramelized honey chipotle wings. Favorite entrées: vegan forest, latin ramen, middle east duck. Favorite dessert: 5 layer coconut cake (oh how I love thee) Favorite drinks: red sangria, Papa Hemingway, cielo verde.
Great food
Love this place! Outstanding every single time. Food is delicious and unique, drinks are creative, portions are just right. Worth every penny. Been here countless times and it remains a favorite.

5 of us went for valentine's day. Did not like the service or the amount of food. The server was not attentive nor even friendly. She seemed upset to serve us for no reason and basically made us order the prix-fixe Valentine's day course to make it easier on her. Also, didn't even look to realize there's a $15 upcharge for picking the risotto over the vegan option bc was so shocked at her overly insisting us ordering it. Wouldn't come back.  ** The portions were so small, we (2 guys and 3 petite sized women) ended up going to another restaurant afterwards to eat.
One of my favorite spots in canton

Very nice place for romantic date night or to grab a cocktail (however mine were more on the sweet side for my liking). Food was upscale and made with alot of care.  One thing was kinda odd. I was there for a medical lecture dinner and asked if I could have something to go (more then willing to pay for it), and the manager said they had no to go containers. Now I don't know if that was just for my night or its like that ever night.  Parking was free so big plus for downtown.  Staff was friendly enough but one would expect that level of professionalism from a fancy place like this.  I would recommend trying this place if you haven't already.

Excellent experience.... totally stumbled upon this restaurant.... flavorful food, serene atmosphere and delicious drinks. The staff was attentive and informative  about the menu,  and refreshingly  thoughtful with their suggestions. I loved everything about it!❤

The food was very good and on a Tuesday around 6pm it was very quiet and pleasant.  Came in just to try a few apps and have a few drinks.  Although it is a little pricy I was happy with the yucas bravas, arepitas and sangria.  The bartender was a little arrogant for my taste but other than that everything else was great.
This place is amazing, love their food. Also don’t forget to get La Nube for dessert, it was a fantastic light dessert after a full (and amazing) meal. Definitely going to make my way here again!

Truly incredible food, drinks and service. I had to take a star away because my wife and I expected a little bit of different setting. The lights were a bit bright, tables close together, and furniture felt a bit cheap. That being said, def a good spot overall and the bar looked way cool!

Alma cocina has to be one of my favorite restaurants that I have been to so far here in Baltimore. It also has easy park access which is hard to find at some restaurants. I went during restaurant week because it can be a bit pricy. The service and food were both spectacular! The arepas are definitely where you are going to get the bang for your buck! Very filling. I would highly recommend it and I look forward to coming back very soon!
A little pricey, but the food was amazing. There is plenty of off street parking and great ambience.
I enjoyed myself at the restaurant last night the food was I cannot put a stone it is above 5 * and the service was outstanding thank you

Alma Cocina was fantastic. We'd been by there a million times but never went in because I believe they're only open for dinner. Finally we went and we're thrilled by the service, the menu and the food. I had three paella 🥘, which is a dish is never had before, and it was amazing. The apps were yummy and there drinks were too. Definitely a win!

I visited this restaurant during Baltimores Restaurant week, and I was highly pleased. I've always had Alma on my list of places to visit since it was so close to home. The Venezuelan cuisine the have here is phenomenal. From being from Northern Virginia and knowing alot of (Salvadorans, Hondurans, and Mexicans) and indulging in their cultures foods growing up, Venezuelan food is distinctly different. There are multiple flavor that you can get out of a few dishes and you normally wouldn't think of. The owner Irena is so lovely, she is the sweetest and kindest soul you will ever meet. She takes so much pride with the restaurant and the staff and it definitely shows. Highly recommend going to Alma Cocina if you haven't already and try your palette on a new experience.
I hadn't been there in a few years and had the same reaction I had the last time I was there. So good. One of my favorite restaurants!

This is the best restaurant in Baltimore. They food is incredibly tasty and fresh; they obviously put a lot of care and thought into their menu and the dishes they make. They change the menu with good frequency - enough that you don't get bored, but still keep around dishes that you can keep coming back to eat. They have very, very good platanos (and I'm picky). They have a good selection of liquor, and they make one of the best pisco sours (highly recommend their happy hour specials). Overall, the place has a great atmosphere, is very well lit and modern. The waitstaff are very kind and always remember us when we come back. Definitely a must-try - and must-return.

Loved this hidden gem of a Venezuelan restaurant, tucked away in a corner in Baltimore! everything we tried was fantastic! Would highly recommend if you want to take guests or out of town visitors. I do have a complaint about the manager (or whoever picked up the phone) who was quite rude when I called the restaurant to confirm my reservation. Otherwise the food and ambience is very welcoming.
"Hidden" gem.
Always request Angie she is so knowledgeable and gives great recommendations. Will guide you course by course

The best, most delightfully flavorful dinner I've had in a long time! Came for a friend's birthday dinner and from the appetizers through to dessert, cocktails and wine pairings, it was unexpected and amazing. The Casabe & black bean butter was particularly incredible - hope to be back soon.
The best restaurant in Baltimore, excellent food and service.  We will be back soon!

We were 5 people on a business trip to Baltimore. We wanted to reward ourselves by having a nice dinner in a > 4.5 stars restaurant.  The ambiance and food at Alma are really excellent. However, to our surprise, the service was beyond TERRIBLE. It was RUDE and DISRESPECTFUL.  At first, the waiter seemed very annoyed by answering basic questions about the menu. That was bad but OK, after all maybe she was having a hard day, right?...  Then, we had a minor issue with the check, and she brought up the manager. Then things got really TERRIBLE.  For the record, the minor issue was that we needed to split the check to pay with corporate credit cards, but they don't split checks for whatever reason.  The manager came to our table with a VERY patronizing, sarcastic, and rude tone. His poor behaviors included pointing his finger at us, calling one of us "ignorant" (yes, that happened), and not properly listening to us.  The manager kept saying in an ACCUSATORY tone that we were wrong by expecting them to split the check for us. Well, even if he had a point (which it didn't matter at that point), why on Earth he had to treat us with DISRESPECT and SARCASM? We were customers trying to pay for the food we ordered, for God's sake. This man managed to make us feel TERRIBLE after eating at Alma.  This very minor issue with our check really escalated to an unforgettable and scary experience at this fine restaurant. What a bitter taste this manager left on us after spending about $280 on a dinner.  We are very agreeable and reasonable customers. Very rarely we complain. To the owners: I truly believe there is a very toxic work environment at Alma created by this manager. I now feel really bad for the waiters and the fantastic Cook at Alma. I strongly suggest you to investigate the manager's behaviors.
The food and service were excellent! We had the Burrata Salad, the pulled-lamb Arepa, and the seafood Paella. Would come back for each dish again!
Always unique, always tasty!

The Wagyu burger was delicious! Never had anything like it. Would definitely order again. Warm trendy atmosphere. Warm lighting. Friendly service. In our visit, you have to have your table's entire evening order ready before you can order anything. Ie. You can't order an appetizer to start then order meals later.

Certainly one of the best restaurants in Baltimore!  Every dish was absolutely delightful and exceeded expectations. Each had a perfect mix of tangy with rich flavors embraced by other intriguing and tantalizing tastes. The yacas bravas in particular was an outstanding version of a rather basic dish that perfectly balanced the flavors and textures.  I also enjoyed the modern but relaxed atmosphere, softened by warm lights and plants, and the waitstaff were gracious as well!
Ryan was awesome. Her recommendations for drinks, food, and dessert were all spot on. The food is delicious and meticulously designed. Really cool atmosphere,  too.

I’ve been to Alma a couple of times and their staff is just as amazing as the food! People are polite and informative and greet you every step of the way. The food, OMG the food. My most recent visit I stopped in because it was the first Thursday of the month and along with all night happy hour during the summer they have Arepa specials. I enjoyed my Arepa and my sangria and it was the perfect end to my day. Can’t wait to come back for more food.
good Atmosphere
We just love Alma. Delicious food never disappoints. Get the Papa Hemingway if you want an amazing drink. And the ceviche is so good!!

We had a great time and really enjoyed the food and service. However, we were a party of 7 and gratuity of 20% was added by the restaurant. Anything over 6 they add it, we found out. While the service was good, we feel that added gratuity, especially at a place like Alma, is tacky. We also tend to tip more, but never if it's added by the restaurant.
Great, flavorful dishes with a unique blend of Latin flavors.
Apps a little pricey for portion size but taste great, mains we're outstanding would come back again

Amazing food, great service, and wonderful atmosphere.  I highly recommend.  The pisco sour and margarita were phenomenal.  We had the wings, ceviche, and 2 arepas for 2 and we're very satisfied.  Also, order the cloud like dessert.

We just had one of the best meals of our lives at Alma. Seriously. From the moment we walked in, all the way to the magical cloud dessert at the end, it was absolutely fantastic. Our server, Megan, was A++. Such great recommendations for food and wine; I’d trust anything Megan suggests. Beautiful space and lovely atmosphere. Highest of recommendation from us! We will absolutely be back.
Everything about this place is amazing. The ceviche is the best thing I’ve ever tasted in my life

The food was actually pretty good. I had the arepas (lamb arepas) and yuccas bravas. Our servers were nice.  However the manager (Paul) of the restaurant was very rude to us, and refused to apologize when his behavior was addressed. The servers at the restaurant apologized for his behavior. He seems to have anger and comprehension issues, which his staff seem to be aware of. We were told when we walked in that happy hour was only available if you sat (for the entirety of your meal) at the bar. That was fine. We sat at the bar, but witnessed someone coming to the bar to order and then taking their drink back to a table that was not at the bar. When we asked the manager why this was allowed in this instance, we were informed that the area the person was seated in was designated the bar as well even though he was at a table. We were told that there was a bar and a dining room, and that happy hour was only served in the bar.  We understood this and did not have an issue with this part of his explanation. However, when the manager told us there were no servers in the bar area, it aroused a question given the fact that we had seen several servers around the table area designated as the bar space. When asked to clarify about the existence of servers serving customers in an area we were told was not supposed to have servers, the manager became agitated, and started raising his voice at us so loudly that all of his staff and onlookers in the restaurant took notice. He repeated that there was a bar area and a dining area (about 6 or 7 times) while waving his hands wildly.  When told that a question was specifically being asked about why there were servers seen in the area he said was not supposed to have servers, he continued to repeat the same refrain about the fact that there was a bar area and a dining area, without answering the question. I should mention that the manager is an American, and no language barrier existed between us. He simply did not understand the question being asked, and instead of handling the situation calmly, began to raise his voice and speak down to his customers (us). He was eventually interrupted by the bartender, who had been watching and appeared to be attempting to jump in. She understood our question immediately, and answered professionally without any trouble.  When he left our area we were apologized to by several servers for his behavior.  There are several other good South American inspired cuisines in the area if you want to go to one with a better manager, which I would highly reccomend. Sota Sopra, Points South (apologies if spelling is off) both have better or comparable food with comparable or cheaper prices, and might be a better dining experience.

Had a fantastic dinner at Alma Cocina on Tuesday night. Really great atmosphere with a open space lots of bar seating and nice dining area along with a small patio for outdoor dining. Place was not very crowded given it was a Tuesday night but I would imagine it getting busy during peak hours and days. They do not take reservations as far as I am aware. Had a few amazing cocktails - bartender makes very good drinks. The food was superb - highly recommend the ceviche and can’t go wrong with an arepa. I also had duck for large plate and was cooked perfectly. The bread pudding dessert was also spot on. This will be my new go to place in Baltimore - only regret is that I did not try sooner.
Nice decor. Fresh ingredients. Kind staff. Yuca bravas are so good

Alma is the perfect combination between warm, traditional LATAM comfort food and deep expertise, creativity and technique. It is the ideal place to have a date or s night out with friends. Get the casava chips and the tiki tangs drink. Plus, there are plants everywhere and the atmosphere is very welcoming and comfortable.
Not a Good Experience for me.

Where to start? I came with my girlfriend and left with a fiancé. It was a great place to propose! From the owner down to the host, everyone did their part to make it special. Special shout out to Andrew for serving us and Paul for treating us to a few items to make it memorable! The vibe was welcoming, the food was outstanding, and the beverage program is excellent as well. Try their Venezuelan arepas but don’t stop there. We did the prie fixe menu and I can’t wait to come back in the future. Thanks everyone

such a great atmosphere! it’s an escape from Baltimore with a cozy, classy feel and bright plants and large windows.  the food was amazing! it is pricy, but the food was beautiful and so tasty! the arepas are the amazing and more food than i expected - lots of meats! and so much flavor.  our table showed the Yuccas Bravas - which was smaller than we expected, but delicious. i loved the sauces.

Went after my daughters graduation from JHU; terrible place, expensive tasteless food with a very small menu. My wife asked about the spiciness of the pork dish since she doesnt like hot food and the waiter told her it wasnt bad, she couldn't finish it. My polenta was bland, tasteless, completely tasteless , same as eating a piece of cardboard. My kids had a couple of very small arepas ( $ 12 each ) also tasteless. We asked for cassava bread for the table, it came a t a whopping price of $ 12 if we wanted guacamole with that, another $ 6. This place has terrible food at exorbitant prices ( and I travel for work so I constantly dine on high rated restaurants , so I can make a judgement )
Best ceviche I’ve ever had. And this is from someone who has been to Perú and eaten at some of the best Peruvian restaurants there.  Their wings are amazing too.
More like a american/south american  fusion restaurant.  If you are looking for latin flavors  this is not  exactly the place. Great  ambiance and  decor  but lacks  flavor.
Great food and nice ambiance.  However,  they need a better sign for the restaurant.   It's hard to see driving down the street.
Fantastic food and atmosphere. Truly does not feel like you're in Baltimore. Love it.
Excellent service.  Great atmosphere for a small group.  Arepas, mushroom tart, potato appetizer, and desserts delicious.
Wild mushroom tart appetizer and polenta entree were delicious. Great service.
Fantastic! Try everything! Be sure to go when they have live music.

My first and second visits to Alma Cocina was great in that the food was extra delicious, especially the Venezuelan Arepas. When I returned on this visit, the Arepas were not available. My and my friends were so sad.
I was there yesterday with my wife and we both really liked the food and the atmosphere. They got really good fries and drinks!

Alma is one of my favorite restaurants in Baltimore. I entertain visiting colleagues and go there with wife. Their dishes are creative and elegant. Tonight's main course was a shrimp anti-arepa, which had shrimp and arepa pieces in a very tasty garlic-cilantro-parsley butter sauce served in a skillet. I highly recommend this place.

The service is fine and the place is nice. However, my wife and I went there in March 2019 and didn't like the food at all. We ordered 4 different things, we didn't like any of the dishes. The BBQ arepa was so sweet that it should be called honey pork arepa.
Great meal and lovely setting. Didn’t feel like we were in Baltimore. Drinks were interesting to say the least. If you’re open minded this is a great experience.
Angie was amazing!

As a Venezuelan, I was expecting more options from my home country. That didn’t happen.  The Papa Hemingway drink is TO DIE FOR. So good. I wish they didn’t put that big chunk of ice in the glass.  The tequenos were delicious. As well as the yuca.  Little pricy to be honest.

It is not often I give a 5 star review, but I can say without a doubt that this was THE best dinner that I've had in Baltimore thus far. The service, food, drinks, and atmosphere were top notch. Most bars and restaurants in Baltimore start to blend into one another - same kind of food, same look and feel, so Alma Cocina Latina was a breath of fresh air. Highly recommend and cannot wait to go back.

Alma Coco has to be one of my favorite restaurants in Baltimore from their charming staff to their knowledgeable and extraordinary Chef to literally one of the best bartenders in the city I can’t stress enough how much you should probably go if you haven’t been yet! And make sure you jump around the menu
Great experience and food every time I visit Alma.

We recommend the combination of the pork loin and the cauliflower entrees .. wholly and delightfully delicious .. and the most unusual "coconut cake" was not bad either.  Alma Cocina Latina should be on the rocketing up and at 'em list if you're looking for something different and special just a few blocks right down east off of Fells Point ..!
Very good food pleasing to the eye and the palate!
Excellent authentic dishes and terrific service. Truly a special place in Baltimore
A visit will transform you! Authentically Venezuelan. Excellent quality.

Don’t let the location in a shopping center fool you- this restaurant is truly a unicorn in the Baltimore restaurant scene. I go fairly often because the food doesn’t just taste amazing- it’s so gorgeously presented as well (and I live in the neighborhood too- but plenty of parking there for those who don’t!) Chef is always refreshing the menu seasonally and the cocktail program is top notch. Meat eaters and vegetarians alike will be able to find something equally tasty here. Well worth a visit!

Super wonderful staff for allergies.  I have a significant number of severe food allergies and dietary restrictions, but really wanted to be able to go to dinner with a group of friends. The wonderful staff at Alma made me feel incredibly welcome, rather than a burden, and went above and beyond to make something I could eat. When I got my food (arepas with chicken, steak, egg and avocado) it was delicious and completely safe for me to eat. It’s incredibly rare to find a restaurant this willing to make people with severe allergies feel welcomed, and that can still serve something delicious within the dietary limitations on a busy Saturday night. (PS- the drinks are amazing as well!)  Thank you so much Alma!
Great food prepared with artistic flair
Great food, great wine, great cocktails.  It's nice to have something other than the standard upscale bay food in the neighborhood.  I've never had a bad meal or drink here.

One of my favorite restaurants - beautiful, soulful ambience, excellent service, astonishingly fresh, delectable dishes. Recommend the tuna tartare, all the arepas, squash soup. Cocktails are also awesome - love the bar. Proprietor Irene Stein makes it feel like home.
Wide ranging menu with numerous differing styles and types of cuisine.  The staff is cordial and the food tasty.
Delicious drinks through dessert. Great service! Looking forward to next visit! Popular place to celebrate the winter solstice!
Great decor and staff. Food was good but not great. And a little on the pricey side. I wish they offered more authentic Venezuelan dishes. Arepas were good but oily.
Love this place. Everything was delicious. It’s pricey. So maybe a special occasion if you’re tight on cash, but the food is so worth it. Cocktails are great too.
Super friendly staff. Flavorful food and unique drinks
perfect.
Easily, one of the best resturants in the city.
World class Venezuelan eatery.  A can't miss!
Excellent restaurant with reasonably priced wine. I definitely recommend trying an arepa.
Very different from other places. Good Venezuelan food and variety of dishes.
Excellent...good hot flavorable food and superb service
Best restaurant in Baltimore by far. Food is amazing and beautiful

I would give them 10 stars. The restaurant is beautiful inside, the staff very courteous but the food is outstanding. The food is the real protagonist. The combination of flavors, are risky in their contrasts and amazing in their final results. The Venezuelan flavors mixed with Local products is genius. Definitely will go again when visiting the city.

Staff 4.5 stars...  Kitchen... 2.75 stars....   We had a table for 6 this past Saturday. We walked in the door, and were seated quickly however the restaurant was out of menus, so we shared 1 for 6 of us for about 10 minutes.  The restaurant was about 1/2 to 3/4 full.  We ordered rounds of drinks, and had about a 10 to 20 minute wait each time we ordered, sometimes they came out with garnish, sometimes the didnt.  The 2 main entree items we wanted to try were both out (bear in mind it's 7pm on Saturday night). Almost everthing from the Kitchen came out properly all be it slowly (and was delicious).. That said we ordered a few steaks, (medium and medium rare).  They both came out somewhere between medium well, and well.   As the Kitchen was running pretty slowly we didnt want to deal with sending them back.. We skipped dessert but the house brought us some home made kit kats (frankly those were better than the steak I ordered).
Delicious
Thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, service , and cuisine. Add this place to your “go to ,can’t miss” places

All around great experience!  Great food, great decor, great drinks, excellent service and staff. I was part of a large group reservation here and the staff could not have been more attentive and efficient, and our food came out fast and correct. Just all around excellent.

The food was amazing, both in taste and presentation. Service was excellent and the atmosphere was lively and trendy. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and wine list. It was a special treat to chat with one of the managers about the ingredients that went into the creation of one of the desserts. Definitely a high end restaurant worth the price of admission!I
Food was great + a refreshing atmosphere!
Incredible food with courteous and attentive service.
Phenomenal food. Presentation beautiful. Great atmosphere. Service both personal and professional.  Chef's creations are tasty and prepared perfectly!  Thank you Sara C.
Great local place food is excellent and ambiance is high class

Great restaurant!  Best food I’ve eaten in a long time. Delicious, exquisite. I take my hat off to the chef, Enrique, and to the owners Irena and her husband. Beautiful environment, very good decorated. I will definitely recommend to everyone. Love it. A.
amazing arepas. Tried several things; all good. The pork shank osso bucco was amazing. Got house made kitkat bars as a bonus (free) dessert.
Very good fancy latin restaurant. Portions are small. A little bit more expensive than it should
Great arepas!
My favorite restaurant in Baltimore right now
The best food in Baltimore. . .period

Excellent! All food were excellent! I loved the yucas bravas, La vaca mariposa arepa and the pulpo was ok. But the desserts were astonishing! Please, try the brownie and the cheesecake (this one was the best one I had in life!). I also drank a brazilian coffee (that I miss a lot). We still received two delicious chocolates as a gift from chef. The service is also good and the restaurant is beautiful. Just go!
Perhaps one of the most underrated restaurants in Baltimore! A true gem!
Alma is so tasty. The cocktails are on point. I also normally don't like gazpacho but it is amazing here. So is the Ossobuco. Not cheap, but definitely worth it!

Absolutely delicious. I would recommend this place if you want to try a different take on pork, taste a Latin flavor, and be pleased with the chocolate dessert Great service, food portions were just right, and great crowd.

This is one of the best restaurants in Baltimore. I've never had anything I didn't like. The menu changes regularly enough while still sticking around long enough to let you try everything for the season.

Truly wonderful atmosphere. The decor is beautiful in the last time I was there there was a flamenco guitarist. The food is delicious and the presentation is gorgeous. Probably the best restaurant in Canton.
The food was insanely good, we split the "Dorade" and appetizer and it was plenty. Thursdays feature live music from 6-9 which was awesome. Will certainly be going back!
Great ambiance and some delicious food. Definitely worth a visit or several!
Great food good cocktails and beverages very nice wait staff with a modern vibe what more can you ask for
One of my fave places in Bmore
Very fun spot with a nice and casual atmosphere.  Server staff was friendly and provided good recommendations.  We had a great meal here.

The food was amazing, both in taste and presentation. Service was excellent and the atmosphere was lively and trendy. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and wine list. It was a special treat to chat with one of the managers about the ingredients that went into the creation of one of the desserts. Definitely a high end restaurant worth the price of admission!
One of the best restaurants i have ever dinned in. Fantastic food, highly recommend it.
Food was delicious, decor was on point, service was great as well. Everything was fresh, tasty, plentiful, and authentic!

I absolutely love this place. From the food, to the decor, to the service, everything about this place is amazing. We went here for Valentine's Day which had a great looking Valentine's Day menu, but after looking at the regular menu we had to try the dishes and I'm so glad we did. We ordered the tartar del mar and tostones del diablo which were phenomenal. For our entrées we ordered ossobuco and pulpo al ajillo which tasted as good as it looked. I wish we had room to try a few more dishes, but with those four dishes we were so full. Honestly I thought I was going to still be hungry when I first saw the dishes being served, but after everything both of us were actually full. I definitely recommend Alma Cocina. I even attached my receipt so you could see the breakdown of how much all of this cost and how reasonably priced everything is. If you get the chance, try this place. You will not be disappointed.
(Translated by Google) very good homemade food  (Original) muy buens comida casera

Absolutely amazing- everything from the service to the food. Not to mention the decor and ambiance is perfect. They were able to accommodate our large family with a baby and even made her a special meal! The owner was also enjoying a meal and came out of her way to welcome us and make sure we were enjoying our meal. The food was unique, tasty and we practically licked our plates clean! Will most definitely be returning here!
Legit

This is a complicated review to write. I'll just make a list of stuff  1) 2 main entrees we're off the menu when we came...not a great start... 2) server said everything was entree sized .... definitely not the case. Cheaper stuff is definitely tapas sized. Split 4 things for 3 people and was definitely hungry at the end (after dessert and an appetizer eaten at home) 3) arepas are huge but the meat was a bit over cooked....also the things are sloppy and all the fixings are at the bottom so it's a bit of a pain to eat 4) GREAT cocktails 5) the churros we're also out for one of the two orders we wanted. Once we got them, the churros themselves we're undercooked, the "Nutella" wasn't Nutella and was bland, the ice cream was melted and lacked flavor. 6) they served one dish (billed as a take on nachos) on an 18" diameter plate...HUGE!! And there were 3 small pieces.... definitely a pain for the table 7) the tartare was AMAZING  So, my 3 star experience is definitely for the experience as a whole. The restaurant is probably more of a 4 if you include the nice atmosphere and pretty good staff
Don't come here for good service.
Perhaps the best total eating experience I've ever had. Amazing!
One of our favorite places in Baltimore. Amazing food and great, unique atmosphere. Definitely one of those places for a date night. A bit pricey but worth every penny.

Went here for restaurant week with my family and also went last year with my wife, for the same week. Both times it was very good food, drinks and service. The owner/head chef/main guy was clearly very into his business and really cared about the customer experience. If you're into a more modern steakhouse this is a good place to check out.
absolutely delicious. i live in los angeles, and am a new yorker - and i'd gladly eat here every night. REALLY that good.
Creative Latin cuisine with an emphasis on flavors. Lovely! Excellent and professional service.

Seriously over priced, over-produced with way too many ingredients many of which are clearly just made up, The ambiance is cold and incredibly noisy.  Arepas are really dry, like eating cardboard.  Had to stop for a burrito on the way home as I was really hungry after my meal here.  No, would not return or recommend.

Food was amazing! Would definitely eat here again. Got to meet the owners and they are the sweetest couple! Perfectly cooked meat and guacamole that is the best guac I've ever eaten! Has parking spaces available too!
Always amazing food and drinks. Will be back for sure!!

One of the most exciting and interesting restaurants in Bmore. Some may complain about prices, but I believe the prices are fair. The dishes are jam packed with flavor, and they will SUPRISE you with things you won't see at other places. The beverage program is progressive and, again, interesting. Fantastic wine list with lots of cool stuff from South America and Spain. If you want ho-hum predictable dining go somewhere else. If you want something delicious and delightful go to Alma.
Simply amazing. Worth the price ALL the way.
I went last Saturday this restaurant in all sense is Excellent!

Good food and nice place but SO obscenely overpriced. I was very excited about the wine list but the vast majority is cost prohibitive. Lowest priced white is $34, lowest price red is $38 and they LEAP in price from there. They are nice bottles but there are no good-value options. Not to mention, the staff clearly has little to no wine knowledge which means they simply recommend high-price options without considering the food-and-wine pairing aspects of the recommendation. Everything was tasty but not even close to worth the price. Baltimore is NOT New York City and I would be surprised if this place made it.

Nice ambiance and decor, impeccable sides and garnish, but only average, at best, meat. The dining room is lovely and cleanly appointed, the staff is friendly and attentive. The meal prices are in the 15-40 dollar range. The side dishes were excellent, with good combination of flavors and presented in an interesting way. The main parts of the dishes, however, were disappointing this time. Despite all the hours of cooking proudly mentioned on the menu, the meat was surprisingly dry and borderline stringy. Copious amount of salt on top did little to improve things. Overall, a good place for tapas, but don't bring a foodie friend here, at least not yet.

I was taken here for Mothers Day and I must say it was hands down the best spot in Baltimore. I moved here recently from NY and finding a decent Latin food place has been a struggle. Although we did not have a table, the bar was just fine for us. You must try La National arepa. It was delicious! The food and customer service of the staff was stellar and I will definitely be returning.
Excellent food and cocktails!
Arepas and dinner were fabulous.  Not too fond of the coffee, desert was okay.  Tge service was good. Will be back.

Hands down one of the best dinners I've ever had. Not only was the food amazing but the aesthetic of the venue is also fantastic. The best part, though, was the amazingly friendly staff. One of the owners, a Venezuelan woman (I wish I'd caught her name), came up to my date and I and asked us about our cameras. Then she showed us her photography books and even allowed us to take photos of the entire restaurant.  The food was amazing. We both got an Arepas and it was fantastic and filling.

IT IS the best restaurant in Baltimore; don't let anyone convince you otherwise. The arepas are fantastic, mains are inventive, and the cocktails/wine are on point. Pro tip, to split an arepa, just rip it in half. Don't bother cutting. Plus, can't go wrong with Rodrigo y Gabriela on the stereo. Half price bottles on Wednesday are a welcomed deal.

I dream of going here once a month! The food the and the drinks are amazing the service are all exquisite! Just a great place for a drink at the bar or a have dinner for a special occasion, and I always feel so glamorous in their beautiful space.
Service was awesome as was everything we had, the lengua is melt in you mouth, Their version of a Cuban sandwich is the best I've ever had
The food and service were both incredible. I'd highly recommend trying Alma for any occasion.

Our first meal at Alma Cocina Latina was -- bar none -- the best meal I've had in Baltimore in ten years.  I do a pretty good job of staying up to speed on the newest and best restaurants in Balto...it's my home town and not that big a place.  I was aware of Alma Cocina Latina, but hadn't yet been by as I live in the sweet spot between Hampden/Remington/Woodberry/Charles Village/Roland Park.  We can walk to scores of the best restaurants in town in 15 mins...no need to venture down to Canton.  Then I read the rave in WaPo and put Alma Cocina Latina on the "must do" list.  So glad that we did.  We were greeted by a familiar face...former front of house guy at The Food Market -- and seated quickly. We explained to Scott, our server, that we were generally unfamiliar with Venezuelan food -- outside arepas -- and would be happy for him to walk us through the menu.  He took precisely the right amount of time...explaining and answering questions without hovering or being supercilious.  We tried the Ceviche Mixto after confirming that the octopus was going to be prepared in some way other than a quick bath in citrus/acid.  We were assured that it is cured (sorry, but semi-raw octupus is not a way I'm going to start a meal).  This ceviche  was among the best I've ever eaten, and the portion was surprisingly large...easily enough to split and satisy as an appetizer for two.    I asked specifically about the micro-greens as the were pretty 'flavor forward' in spots and learned that the sous chef grown them personally.  I expect that since they were very fresh, they were prominent.  Having sampled something from the sea, we had meat(s) in an arepa...deciding on the "Mariposa" (why they named it "butterfly" I can't say.  Go there.  Ask.)  It also was the best I've had...though it was so 'overstuffed' that it would be impossible to eat by hand w/o wearing some home on the front of one's shirt.  We left it on the plate and took turns forking out seared chicken, tender stewed beef and a delightfully underspiced chorizo.  When we got it down to a manageable size, we picked it up and discovered the fried egg and avacodo in the base which had benefited greatly from the juice and spice from above.  Then is was 'vegetarian' entree, also gluten free, medanos de falcon.  Scott described the kitchen's attempt to replicate the desert region from which it is inspired as "terroir" which I think may have not been the right term.  (I understand that to mean that the flavor of the area in which the ingredients are grown infuses the product.)  The description of the dish when presented indicated this was am much a visual representation as a flavor one...so maybe "terroir with visuals".  Anyway it was 'lick the plate" delicious and the black bean/sweet coconut puree that dotted the dish was a revelation.  Just try it.  If you have a vegetarian friend who always feels kinda left out take them to Alma Cocina Latina and order this.  Friend for life.  We'd saved room for dessert and are very grateful we did.  When our "marquesa" was brought to the table, Scott went uncharacteristically quiet.  I asked why and he said the dish was such a mixture of unfamiliar textures and flavors that he'd prefer to come bacj when we were done and ask how it was.  Good call. It's a melange of Almond butter cream, macadamia & almond crumble, vanilla toffee, lemon zest, vanilla-caramel ice cream, almond cracker, citrus meringue.  I mean who thinks of putting lemon into meringue and making a cracker out of it?  The almond butter cream and the ice cream are the same color...but different flavors, textures and temperatures...so it's an interactive mystery to eat.  Anyway...sheesh.  I have not intended to take this much time raving about this place.  It was great.  Go.
Amazing food. Went for brunch and all of food was outstanding. The dining room is also very cheerful.

I have lived and dined in Baltimore for over a decade now, and I have to say Alma Cocina Latina is hands down the best restaurant I have visited yet. The food here is *out of this world*. I have been to this restaurant 5 or 6 times now for a full course meal, and every time I am blown away by the dishes served (I've ordered something different every time). The menu is vibrant and creative - there really is not anything else like it in Baltimore. If you have not been to Alma Cocina Latina yet, you must. Not only are the food and cocktails exquisite, but the staff here really make the dining experience special - everyone is warm and excited to tell you about the food and the Venezuelan culture. So much love for this place. 5 stars just isn’t enough.

The food was delicious and the service was very good.  Also the cocktails phenomenal.  I am giving it four stars though because we were waiting on a guest and they closed the kitchen without letting us know.
Great food!!!
Great food and drinks!

First time trying Venezuelan cuisine. Had Burrata and sausage Arepa (A) and Ceviche mixto (A) for apps, Bison Tongue (A) and Halibut (B) for entrees and Latin Passion Love(A++) for dessert. My Sangria was very flavorful and my Husband's beer and port were very good too. The flavors are fresh and new to our pallets, and very yummy. The service was great. The ambiance was modern, kind of "canteen-ish", but quite cozy (the only unpleasant thing we've experienced is the cold drift from the entree door openings). In point of value it's not cheap but worth it. Next time we'll order more of their appetisers and desserts that we enjoyed a lot rather then entrees. Also a big + is free and easy available parking. All together it was not quite a 5** but still great experience and we definitely will be back.
This place is great.  Ample parking in front, completely family friendly, caring service, excellent food.  I wish they were open on Sunday too!

This is a great local spot. So different than what can find at other restaurants with a cool vibe and variety of dinner options. Little on the pricey side but well worth it. I'd recommend getting an arepa as every type I've tried I've enjoyed.
Fantastic venezuelan food in a beautiful light space.
Awesome place. I love thw latin food.
They had the answers

The decorations were awesome - didn't feel like a baltimore restaurant. i was with a group of 4 and all of our cocktails were SO good - refreshing and tasty. We ordered 5+ plates off the menu to share and they were all delicious. can't wait to go back!
Got the ceviche and chicken and a few cocktails. Great service and sat outside for the great weather. All awesome
Great deals for restaurant week, and all the food was absolutely amazing! You can not go wrong with Alma Cocina
For handcrafted Venezuelan food in Canton, this is the place. Try an arepa or two -- my friend and I really liked La Nacional, which features shredded beef and plantains.
Whatever you are doing, stop right now and go to Alma. Order a pitcher of sangria and a deviled ham arepas. Your life will be a better place, I promise.

This place feels like an oasis in a strip mall. Its minimal rustic interior with clean lines and open floor (as well as fully exposed kitchen) feels at once classic and edgy. The staff are prompt and knowledgeable. The drinks are pretty great. A lot of rum-based offerings, so if that's not your thing it's too bad because the ones I tried were well balanced with unique flavors. The arepas are basically flawless. I had the cochinillo and could have had at least two more of them but also wanted to try a proper entree. Definitely the right call. Had the ceviche mixto, which at $20 was a great deal with urchin, shrimp, octopus carpaccio, scallops and more I surely forgot. Everything was prepared perfectly. With some even bigger priced items, this felt like a place for special occasions but if you want to just get arepas you couldn't find a better space in Baltimore.
Fresh and beautiful! We take out of town guests here without fail. The crabcake arepa is my favorite.
Great food, you have to try the arepas. Really nice place, outdoor tables are perfect for the summer weather.

Authentic in every way and not ashamed to tell you about it. The cocktails are in a class all their own and it offers plenty of fine dining options. What separates Alma from the others is its versatility, you can eat outside or at the bar on the cheap (every Arepa on the menu is fantastic) or you can go all out with their rotating menu of innovative Venezuelan dishes. Also, don't miss any of the ceviches but if you have to choose only one go with the Vuelve a la vida.
Amazing food, ample portions, delicious cocktails, and a fun ambiance. Can't wait to get back. Definitely a treasure of Canton!
Amazing latin fusion !!! Highly recommend.
Tasty!
Very pretty. Lots of whisky.
One of the best dining experiences I've had in baltimore.  Cocktails to dessert were all superb, and the service was amazing!  Highly recommended!!!
Genuine Venezuelan food. Visit it if you feel adventurous and want to taste something new
WOW!!!!, I was there on Valentines day and I just can say that this place is awesome, Incredible atmosphere and delicious food. We really had a blast date....  Thank you!

This place is absolutely incredible. Their food is so fresh and delicious and the drinks are all really good too. Arepas are a must try as well as the margaritas. The interior is also very nicely adorned with wall hung plants and modern tables and bar and it makes for a great dinner experience.

It's a wonderful place with amazing food. The place is set up beautifully and is very captivating. The service and the food too are just as delightful. I love this place and definitely recommend it to all the people. They also have salsa dancing every Saturday from 10:00 PM on-wards.

A new addition to the Boston Street Restaurant scene, Alma Cocina Latina brings new dimension to the local dining scene with some unique Venezuelan specialties. The lobster and squid ceviche in a tomato based sauce was different from the citrus focused versions most other restaurants served, but was delicious. The appetizers are also excellent and great for sharing. On the drinks side, Alma Cocina offers a good amount of unique cocktails and a strong selection of wines and sangria. The atmosphere was lively for a Saturday night, and there was even salsa dancers for entertainment, of which some of the staff joined in on. Overall it was a very good experience, though they appear to be positioning themselves on the higher end of the dining experience, with higher prices to go with it.
